instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
this macbook had had liquid damage, i replaced trackpad connector, i also changed efi chip, battery was dead and put in a new one. Today I connected the battery without fixing with double sided tape, I switched it on and everything went smoothly. Before turning off I deactivated autoboot with a command from the terminal. I turned off, I unplugged the battery, I reconnected everything and now it does not turn on anymore. When I connect the charger it has a normal current draw and 20v, the symbol of the charged battery appears for a moment and then nothing, dead. It does the same thing if I close and reopen the lid, for a moment just the battery symbol.
What can I do? all this is very strange .....

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
Please, write in english; or use an online translator.

Test the board alone on the desk, without battery connected.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?

When you touch the battery, disconnect J6951.
Battery data cable is the first to disconnect and last to reconnect.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
Test the board without battery connected.
Do you still get low battery symbol?

Check the voltage on the big coils; anything at L7210/20?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
solved, I bought a bios chip already programmed, it worked for a day, I got one from another logic board and now everything works !!
I don't know if the terminal command "sudo nvram AutoBoot =% 00"
  may have created some problem with the bios chip.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message: You need to clean ME region, or weird issues will appear on the future.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
thanks for the information, I don't have a chip programmer, I would like to buy one, even for newer macbooks, which programmer do you suggest?
At the moment the macbook seems to be doing very well, very fast start-up, fans under control, perfect battery !!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't turn on after battery replacement
threads.message:
If you plan to stay in business with Apple boards, buy Medusa programmer.
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.cmizapper.com/products/medusa-3.html[/URL]

You may need to get few EasyFlash adapters also; listed by models, like here:
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.cmizapper.com/board/mbpr/index.html[/URL]

You can use cheaper programmers, like CH341A; need to remove the SPI chip from the board, in such case.
